word:
Chap. 32 - Self-Improvement

Manuscript 91, 1903

     [Address given Thursday morning, August 20, 1903, at the Teachers' Institute, College Chapel, Healdsburg, California. Portions appear in Evangelism and The Voice in Speech and Song.] 


     I have been thinking much in regard to what the Word of God is to us. As we read this Word, we are to remember that God is speaking to us, and teaching us. Take, for instance, the book of Revelation. We all know that there are many who regard this scripture as a closed book, because they cannot understand it; and yet it is a revelation that Christ has given in order to enlighten our understanding.
